events.description: Bitcoin fell below the $70,000 threshold for the first time since October 2024.
A broad selloff in speculative positions across various asset classes.

facts.fact_text: Bitcoin fell below $70,000 for the first time since October 2024.

evidences.evidence_text: Bitcoin sank to below $70,000 for the first time since October of 2024

facts.fact_text: Bitcoin has experienced a 25% decline since the beginning of the year.

evidences.evidence_text: marking a 25% plunge since the start of the year

facts.fact_text: Bitcoin's price movement is currently tracking the decline in gold.

claims.claim_text: Bitcoin is no longer serving as an effective hedge against inflation or geopolitical stress.

evidences.evidence_text: breaking against the view of a hedge against inflation and geopolitical stress

claims.claim_text: Increased institutional ownership has made Bitcoin more susceptible to derisking trends.

evidences.evidence_text: higher share of Bitcoin in institutional portfolios made it more vulnerable to derisking

claims.claim_text: Retail traders are shifting away from cryptocurrency toward other speculative instruments like AI ETFs and zero-day options.

evidences.evidence_text: decline in cryptocurrency holdings by retail traders on the broader range of substitutes for speculative trading, including leveraged ETFs with exposure to AI companies, zero-day options for equities, and the rise of betting markets

evidence.evidence_text: higher share of Bitcoin in institutional portfolios made it more vulnerable to derisking
derisking, which recently dominated trades following higher volatility and margin requirements in precious and base metal derivatives
breaking against the view of a hedge against inflation
